data.description:
## Problem
Edge entities accept arbitrary edge_type strings without validation. The valid edge types are defined in entity_schemas.py:230-234 but NOT enforced in types.py.

## Current State
- EdgeSchema.EDGE_TYPES defines 12 valid types: DEPENDS_ON, BLOCKS, CONTAINS, RELATES_TO, REQUIRES, IMPLEMENTS, SUPERSEDES, DERIVED_FROM, PARENT_OF, CHILD_OF, REFERENCES, CONTRADICTS
- Edge.__post_init__ validates weight/confidence ranges (lines 338-350)
- NO validation of edge_type string

## Solution
Add validation in types.py Edge.__post_init__:
```python
VALID_EDGE_TYPES = {
    'DEPENDS_ON', 'BLOCKS', 'CONTAINS', 'RELATES_TO',
    'REQUIRES', 'IMPLEMENTS', 'SUPERSEDES', 'DERIVED_FROM',
    'PARENT_OF', 'CHILD_OF', 'REFERENCES', 'CONTRADICTS',
}
if self.edge_type not in VALID_EDGE_TYPES:
    raise ValidationError(f"Invalid edge_type: {self.edge_type}. Must be one of: {VALID_EDGE_TYPES}")
```

## Files
- cortical/got/types.py:315-378 (Edge class)
- cortical/got/entity_schemas.py:230-234 (EDGE_TYPES list)

## Acceptance Criteria
1. Invalid edge types raise ValidationError at creation time
2. All existing edge types in production data still work
3. Unit tests added for valid/invalid edge types
4. Move VALID_EDGE_TYPES to single source of truth (types.py, re-export in entity_schemas.py)
data.title: Enable edge type validation in Edge.__post_init__
